Can you explain why the `listaddressgroupings` command returns a single array of addresses and their corresponding amounts?

The `listaddressgroupings` command actually returns an array of arrays, where each inner array represents a group of addresses with their corresponding amounts. This is because the command is designed to show groups of addresses that are related by their common ownership, rather than just listing individual addresses.

listaddressgroupings

Lists groups of addresses which have had their common ownership
made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change
in past transactions

Result:
[
 [
  [
   "VRSC address",   (string) The VRSC address
   amount,         (numeric) The amount in VRSC
   "account"       (string, optional) The account (DEPRECATED)
  ]
  ,...
 ]
 ,...
]

Examples:
> verus listaddressgroupings 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listaddressgroupings", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
